text: Keg at Port Street Tavern, Manchester. A very hazy ochre colour. Very strong hop aroma. Spicy, fruity hop notes. Not heavy, but by no means lacking depth of flavour.

200617. Can from Greenslopes Cellars. This might be a Session IPA however it has a big hoppy aroma and pours a murky dull yellow colour. Full bodied in the mouth with a big hop kick. You could almost mistake this for an imperial IPA if you didnt know better.

Rami Rami is drinking an Inhaler by Magic Rock Brewing at Konstruktorska Business Center

Bardzo intensywne, pomaranczo-mandarynko-zywiczne, dosc spora goryczka, niezbyt lekkie w odbiorze, robi wrazenie

Lata 33 cl de Vivalabirra tomada en Oviedo 13..06.. 2017. (r00). Color amarillento ámbar turbio con espuma blanca persistente. Sabores frescos herbáceos y cítricos. Cuerpo ligero fácil de beber con algo de gas. Refrescante y buena.

Drunk at Eastern Lodge Euston Tap in glass from a can. Very deep orange appearance with slight foam. Very juicy aroma and taste. Great as a cold summer beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can. Sweaty, pineapple hop aroma. Grey cloudy, white lace. Orange juice, clay, light pine and pineapple. Medium light body, pleasant.
Can. Murky orange color with white head. Aroma is sweaty, orange juice, a bit crystal malts. Taste is grainy, bready, orange juice. Medium carbonation, mineralic finish. Fun!

Color naranja, turbio y completamente opaco, con capa de espuma blanca de tres dedos de grosor (no mucha retención). Carbonatación media. Textura acuosa y ligeramente efervescente. Aroma a marihuana, resina, cítricos, fruta tropical, lúpulo, sutil malta caramelizada. En boca hay mucho cítrico, fruta tropical (mango, fruta de la pasión), hierba húmeda, resina. Muy lupulada y ello se deja notar. Buen contraste entre acidez, dulzor y amargor. Escaso amargor final y escaso postgusto. Quizá más APA que SIPA, pero riquísima de todas formas.
Aroma: hops, biscuit, caramel and citrus. Taste: citrus, pine, citrus, grapefruit bitterness. Small head, poor lacing and medium carbonation.

On tap @ Edinburgh Beer Festival. Note on my phones a bit cryptic for this one: Another classic pale ale from Magic Rock. IDK what sort of water [sic?] theyre using but it sure lends itself to the style.
Can. Golden pour. Aroma of citrus, peach, caramel and biscuity malt. Taste has citrus, grassy pine, biscuity malt, bitter hop and peach. Nice sipa.

On tap at Edinburgh Beer Fest. Strong skunky aroma. A sweet piney, citrus taste in the forefront with a bitter background. Full, but somewhat watery mouthfeel; not as creamy as some other Magic Rock sessions.
Taster at EBCF, Very dry aroma, more of that on the taste. Crackers, biscuits, some hops. Bit one dimensional. OK, and sessionable, but other beers would be in the queue for that.
Keg at ecbf 2017. Pours golden orange, nose is sweet toffee, orange peel, taste is similar, dry.

Lovely fruit bomb of a Pale Ale that is only 4.8% making it a perfect party session beer. Nice 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can from Redmonds. Aroma is slightly sweet, orange/blood orange. Medium fizz which does quickly, and it behaves like a small batch, properly made beer. Which is refreshing. In a metaphorical sense. While the beer is also refreshing. In a literal sense. Chewy piney hops but not overly so, nice tropical notes as well. Very much in the British brewers take on an American Pale Ale style. The baseline of which is Gamma Ray. It tastes like Gamma Ray. Maybe a tad sweeter. Definitely less bitter and less fizzy. Really good. In fact.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

21-MAY-2017, can @home, from Arnes, Westmarket.
Very hoppy orange with a lasting White head. Dusty hops. Sweet malt, toasted. Medium body, mostly dry. Bitter. Nice Little one.

A pleasant juicy IPA with lots of flavour for a low % beer. This beer can cut it as a good beer but thing is though, nothing outstanding about it. Pluss magic rock have some better brews. Definitely worth a try though!

Pours amber with a large head.
Nose shows caramel, pine, spicy hops, toffee, earthy hops and orange marmalade.
Flavours include more caramel and bready malt, spicy and piny hops, herbal notes and biscuity malt.

0,33 l can 
hoppy and citrus fruity aroma, amber, cloudy, minimal head, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, thin feel, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish, Nice Session IPA
330ml can, contains live yeast. Poured opaque orange after rough transport. Aroma tropical fruit. Light bitterness, finish dry. A pleasant refreshing drink with impressive hop taste.

Can from Beers of Europe. Poured a murky light amber with a bubbly white head. The aroma is grassy hop, grainy malt, light tropical fruit. The flavour is moderate bitter with a crisp dry floral hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

Can from Craftbeer Gallery. Pours hazy amber. Aroma is tropical fruit, mango, citric. Body is medium, sweet, fruity, lightly bitter, crisp carbonation. Mango, passion fruit. Lots of residual sweetness. Fruity palate, rather dry. Good, balanced and delightfully sessionable.

33 cl, can conditioned, BB date expired 3 weeks ago... Pours a cloudy dark golden orange, thick off-white head, low carbonation, loads of powdery, and quite a few chunky, sediments, nice lacing. Aroma is tropical and piny. Mouthfeel is oily and bitter, a bit flat on the carbonation. Flavour is tropical and juicy, but I really wish Id had a fresher can. Cannot recommend this to anyone. Big shame.
Tåkete gulbrun med lavt hvitt skum. Lukter mango, sydhavsfrukt og korn. Middels fylde. Fruktig bitterhet, grapefrukt og mango. Middels langt

Can from Westhill Service Station. Pours cloudy orangey gold with thin off white (almost dirty looking) head. Aromas lovely tropical mango and fresh pine. Sweet caramel underneath with a damp green leafy finish. More mango on the taste with fizzy orangeade. Grassy pine bitterness balances nicely. Its wonderful but like the body feels a little diluted. Moderate lively fizz with a thin body. A brilliantly sessionable ale. Looking forward to having another.

Keg at St Albans Beer Shop, St Albans, UK. It pours hazy deep orange, with a small white head. Aroma is fruity, lot of berries, apricot, peach, orange, some notes of malts. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Body is medium, average carbonation. Finish is less fruity and much bitter. Overall nice but not one of my favourite of Magic Rock.
Can from Park Fever, Hither Green. Hazy orange pour with a white head. Apricot, tangerine and grapefruit aroma. Flavours of bitter citrus, earth, light herb. Bitter hop laden finish.Good

Can, pours an ultra hazy bright orange with medium white head. Aromas and flavor dank Resin, grapefruit, bitter pine, oranges, and pale malts. Medium bodied. Another nice one from the dudes at Magic Rock.

Juicy with tropical aroma of blood orange, passion fruit, and mango. Color is a hazy amber. Body is dry and crisp with a superb mouthfeel. Bitterness is very subtle but pleasant. Overall a very good contemporary pale ale.
UPDATED: APR 22, 2017 Keg at the Herbert Kilpin, Nottingham. A tasty orangy grapefruity thing with a long bitter finish. Its very nice. Lovely. Yes.
Pours pineapple aroma. Taste is pineapple, grapefruit, melon. Nice but body is too thin making it less juicy than it could have been. Moderately bitter.Nice
From a can, great pineapple and melon aroma . More citrus flavours, with a gentle bitter finish .

On can from Vinmonopolet Aker Brygge some weeks ago. Hazy golden color, good foam.
Medium aroma intensity; fruity, hoppy, citrus and some tropical fruits- harmonic.
Medium body & complexity. Good bitterness- very well balanced. Very enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can, pours a cloudy pale orange gold. Aroma is big juicy tropical hops, lots of mango, guava and orange, with spice and sappy pine. Malts are light caramel. Light medium body with an oily texture. Finish is long, fruity and light bitter. Carbonation is soft.

Can. Pours a dense hazy orange with a thin lacy off white bubbly head. Aroma is of oranges, caramel, chocolate, grapefruit, citrus, peach. Taste is of citrus, grapefruit, grassy, earthy, orange, herby. Syrupy oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Can. Slightly hazy orangish amber with a fading white head. Earthy aroma with citrus and pine, vague tropical fruit - dirty bubblegum. Light bodied, medium high carbonation - liked it better after a swirl or too. Cleaner than suggested by the aroma with better defined fruit. Bitterness is not high and doesnt linger, but it certainly cuts through.

Can @ Café Jacks, Tilburg. Clear light orange color, medium to full sized white head. Aroma is lovely fruity hoppy, very refreshing. Taste lightly malts, again very refreshing fruity hops, tropical fruitiness, soft fruity hop bitter, bitter. Easy drinkable but with a solid body. Awesome session IPA!

Can. Aroma of tropical fruit . Pours a cloudy but vibrant orange with white lace top. Taste is strongly fruity with mandarin and grapefruit bitterness. Slightly piney and resinous on the palate. I was expecting a crisper finish.

Can, 330ml at Warwick Real Ale, Warwick. Cloudy orange gold with white head. There is a sharp, resinous hoppy character to this from the first sip, drying fruitiness, tropical, papaya along with a biscuity, crystal malt. Refreshing and lasting. Good beer.

On tap at Øst, Stavanger. Pours hazy amber with dense off-white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, some pine needles, some citrus. Tastes bitter with little sweetness. Thin to medium bodied, bitter finish.
hazy amber with a fine head. very nice aroma of pine, mango, grapefruit and hints of vanilla. well-balanced taste, very nice bitter finish. a very good session ipa.
330ml can. Pours very murky orange with a medium head. Aroma is pineapple, papaya and melon. Taste is very bitter. Melon to start. Bready papaya finish.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 18B). Can 33 cl - Batch 1263. AROMA: medium hop aromas with notes of pine and dried grass (oxidation). medium oxidized malt (caramelly). APPEARANCE: orange-ish color and hazy. medium white head with average retention. TASTE: similar to the aroma with medium hop notes (pine, slight dried grass). faint citrus fruit. low malt background with a slight oxidized note (caramelly). Medium bitterness with a dry and bitter finish. PALATE: medium-light body with average carbonation. OVERALL: an American Pale Ale like beer (also resembling a NEIPA) where the oxidation started to show.

330 ml can from Gulating Stavanger. Unclear golden body with a big off-white head that fades. Aroma has malt, citric fruit, tropical fruit, mango. Flavor is medium sweet malt, fruity like aroma, orange zest and a bit sharp bitterness. Fine body and fruity bitter aftertaste. Nice and refreshing session ale.

On tap @Ma che siete venuti a fà (Rome). Dorata torbida, schiuma bianca medio-leggera. Naso discretamente esplosivo, sentori fruttati, mango, passionfruit e limone, pesca, erbaceo. In bocca è equilibrata, base di malto media, finale amaro pulito, leggero erbaceo. Corpo leggero, carbonazione media. Non male.

Appearance is cloudy golden, looks like the pee immediately after sex. Aroma is of pine resin, mango, grapefruit, lemon, orange. Taste is fruity with grapefruit, orange, citrus, pear drops, peach etc. Unfortunately the grassy piney hops on the aftertaste dominated a bit too much for me and left a rather bitter taste. Price Paid: around £2 for 330ml can.
Tap @ Cerveteca Lisboa. Pours hazy orange, small white head. Tropical fruits, citrus, pine in the aroma. Juicy, bitter, fruity flavour.

Sweety Nektarinenerfrischer mit saftigem Anstrich. Malty, grasy und ein SIPA Masterpiece. Das Finish ist so gar nicht schmalbrüstig, sondern schön hoppy und zitronenbespritzt. 0,33/Unter 3 Okken. BEYOND BEER HH. CAN.
On tap at Empourium, Sundbyberg. Hazy golden/orange with a small white head. Aroma and taste of grass, hops, some malt, grapefruit and light bread. Soft and easy to drink.

Can at the Old Bicycle Shop, Cambridge. Very dark orange/gold. The colour of Donald Trumps remnant of a soul. For a supposed juice bomb, theres very little odour. A bit of tangerine and some candy sugar. Taste is another dimension: sweet and fruity with good hop balance. Bitterness in the shortish finish. Verdict: tries to be Bloody Ell or Juice Box and it just isnt. For a brewery as competent as Magic Rock I expected a lot more. However on its own merits its drinkable if bland, and can certainly hold its own. Probably the best of the three beers Ive had tonight.

Keg at the Victoria Inn, Colchester. Pours hazy amber colour with a small white head. Aroma of grapefruit, passion fruit, peach, grass and hops. Moderate sweetness with medium plus bitterness. Medium body and above average carbonation.

Can, enjoyed two months before bbd. Pours almost opaque golden, with a small creamy head. Aroma is hoppy tropical notes with peaches, nectarines and citrusy notes, 
Light to medium body, with average carbonation. Flavour is hoppy, with herbal, citrus peel, as well as some bitter piney notes.
Can at home. Deep amber in colour. Lovely tropical fruity hoppiness. Fairly light and flavourful. Sessionable.
Cask @ The Victoria Inn, Colchester. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are citrus, fruits, rich hops, flowers, malt and has a nice citrussy hoppy finish.

Keg @ Victoria Inn, Colchester. Pours hazy goldenorange with an creamy offwhite head. Aroma of malt, grass, fresh fruity hops, peach, citrus, grapefruit. Flavor is fairly bitter, grassy, fruity hops, peach, bitter citrus, grapefruit. Medium body, lively carbonation, dry and lasting bitter finish. 170217
Keg. Pours hazy amber. Aroma of grapefruit, orange and bread. Mild sweet and bitter taste. Good easy drinker as you would expect.

Poured from a can. Murky golden color, small white head. Smells like mosaic hop. Medium body with a sweet and grass like me hops flavor and a medium finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A mineral hops aroma with a hint of fruit, pours a clear gold color with a thin white head. A dry feel with a chalky taste and a mineral finish.
Batido de fruta: naranja y piña. Turbia, lupulada. Una delicia. BB 2017/05/21
Can from Clink, Birmingham. Pours fairly flat; but then again, it is remarkably smooth, like thick fruit juice. Great slow release hops, with a bit of radler in the mix. Lovely.
Can. Amber colour, little head. I taste pine resin, grapefruit. Its dry, nice hoppy. Nice bitterness. Medium carbonation. Very good for the low ABV.

Aroma of tropical fruits, citrus, pine, resin and some malt. Hazy Amber with a white head. Medium sweet and medium + bitter. Medium body with a average carbonation. Overall a perfectly decent Session IPA, a bit on the thin side, but quite nice for the ABV.

Bue en canette métallique. Couleur orange assez trouble, mousse dense, nez houblonné bien comme il faut avec une dominante de résineux. En bouche cest dabord les agrumes qui se font sentir, mais avec une amertume qui peut faire penser à de la peau dorange ou de pamplemousse. Notes de pins sur la fin. Les saveurs fruitées allant sur le tropical se font plus sentir en se réchauffant. Amertume très présente, donc difficile de dire que cest "super drinkable" comme le prétend le site officiel. ^^

330ml can (Thirsty, Cambridge)
Murky orange, brief head. Will someone please educate these amateurs in the use of finings? Pretty dreadful stinky hop aroma, a bit fruity and citrussy, but a complete mess. Annas glass was even worse. Medium full palate, OK carbonation. Slightly vegetal hoppy taste. Finish zesty and bitter. No depth, and no balance. Pretty poor brew.

Can shared with sarky northner Peak District family doo. Cloudy amber thin head. Lots of juicy tropics in aroma tadtevssmr nice pine resin good dry hoppy bitter hops lots of juicy grapefruit. Very good.
Can shared with s_hartshorne at the family gathering. Cloudy amber beer with small head. Aroma of juicy fruits, hops and some pine. Taste is stewed fruit, pine resin and tropical fruit. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Tap @ basement beer bar Aalborg. Aroma of citrus, flowery resin hops. Hazy orange with white head, mostly lasting. Taste is moderate bitter and light sweet. Medium body, smooth oily feel and citrus bitter finish.

Can from Flask. Hazy dark orange with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - fruity and grapefruit. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 260117

Can 0.33l from Sterk Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 22.01.2017. Pour it cloudy darkorange color with small white head. Aroma yesty, orange, grassy. Taste nice tangerine, orange, grapefruit, blood oranges note, smooth creamy texture, medium bitterness, aoft sweetness, medium body, lively carbonation, bitter kick finish. Really nice!

Draught at Angleterre. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, hops, peach, resin, a bit of pine and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, hops, peach, resin, pine and grass. Excellent session IPA.

Can. Aroma is grapefruit, orange, citrus. Orange golden amber, cloudy, small white head. Light sweetness, medium bitterness, taste is grapefruit, pineapple, orange, orange zest, resin notes. Light body, medium carbonation, medium long fruity finish with dry bitterness. Refreshing pale ale on the bitter side.
Can from Flask. Fairly clear burnt orange with a small frothy head. Notes of resinous hops, pine, caramel, some citrus, lemon peel and light pineapple.

Cloudy dark golden color with a fine thick off white head. Good lacing. Fine intensity in the aroma. Medium body and a fine smooth carbonation level. Moderate sweet and a fine bitterness. Citric hoppy, biscuit, malty, fruity and pine in the flavor.[Can from Siste Sang Bryggeri in Oslo, Norway]

Herbal, tropical fruits grapefruit.
Hazy body 1 finger white head falling quickly
Light medium body, medium low carbonation. taste is bitter lingering for quite some times when i was expecting a juicy feeling...

Disappointing after smelling it, murky bitter herbal grapefruity more than juicy.

Alla vista una juicy tipica, dal colore arancio di succo. La schiuma è biancastra, fine e vaporosa. Aroma che è un mix di erbe, luppolo agrumi, e la nota fruttata di pesca e ananas. Al palato è interessante, ancora risalta la parte fruttata, ma è comunque decisamente amara con finale abbastanza lungo. Note erbacee e di pompelmo. Carbonazione fine e media, leggera di corpo.

Murky appearance. Strong fruity aroma with lots of grapefruit, pineapple, and nectarine. Taste is juicy, with more of the same elements on the tongue. Refreshing, though the carbonation is a bit high.
Spritziger, herb hopfiger Antrunk. Weiche Herbe im Mittelteil, milde Würzigkeit. Vollmundig, deutlich Zitrus. 10/10/9/10//10
Superb beer. Marked down a little overall because it is not a session IPA by any means, more a cloudy pale ale. Super cloudy, super juicy, mental hop aroma with all the new wave of hops in the mix.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2017 Lots of peach, grapefruit and fruits on the nose but the beer disappoints in the mouth. Lacks all of the fruits in the flavour, just moderate grapefruit bitterness and some veg. Bit thin, it could do with some body to support. Very hazy golden orange.

From Zombier. In Teku glass. At lunch, with rice soup + turkey meat . Pretty nicely juicy in nose but in mouth falls a bit short, not much juicy there. Instead, herbal notes and even slight vegetables notes. Very sessionable.
Can. Grapefruit, spice, citrus. Bitter with a dry finish. Good but not terribly distinctive.
Amber colour with thin head. Aroma and flavour are hoppy with citrus peel and a little pine. Very bitter and flavoursome.

Draught @ William K, kurvi. 
Poured hazy golden color with a thick white head. 
Pineapples and grapefruity aroma. Fresh. 
Grapefruity biting bitterness. Pine, citrus, more hops. Mouthdrying finish. Some herbal notes as well. Pretty tasty session IPA.

330ml can. Pours a cloudy orange-yellow colour with a small off-white head. Aroma: lots of juicy tropical and citrus fruit, grapefruit, mango, mandarin, resin. Taste: like the aroma theres loads of juicy fruit flavours, tropical and citrussy, grapefruit, mango, mandarin, little bit resinous, grassy, good bitterness and long finish. Light-medium body, smooth mouthfeel. Lovely, highly drinkable Juicy Pale Ale as they aptly put it.

Tap at Craft Clerkenwell. Orange lemon and pineapple squash aroma. Taste is good. Very juicy. Similar to above but with a touch of earthiness and some minerals too. Plenty of taste for the strength, but quite a spritzy body too. Light zingy bitterness. Good stuff.

22.12.2016, 0,33l can @ home:
Nice fizzy-creamy mediumlasting head, hazy. Aroma is slightly dry and fresh grassy, leafs, minerals, fresh hops, moss, hay, citrus peel, bark, pine needles, lawn, flowers. Taste is dry grassy, weeds, leafs, hops, bark, minerals, pine needles, soil, lawn, hay, flowers. Longlasting bitterness, slightly dry and harsh grassy mouthfeel. Nice aroma...
really good beer that i am glad i found wish i had got more though will be on the look out for it again

Bottle from the Stockbridge Tap. 
Appearance - deep amber to red and hazy. Decent lacy head. 
Nose - tropical and citrus fruits. Thinking melon and lime.
Taste - apricots and again ripe melon. 
Palate - close to medium bodied with a tangy texture and a long dry finish.
Overall - yes its good.

Can, 4.5% Unclear amber/orange with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, tropical fruit, juicy, orange and a little grapefruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, little tropical fruit, orange, little dry, little sweet and medium bitter.

Can from Brewcraft, drank w Matt at home. Hazy gold-brown with medium off-white creamy foamy head. Smells of musty orange, citrus and overripe mango, dry pith, moderate resin hop and light toasty malt. Taste is quite bitter and piny, light citrus, very very dry. Body is light to medium. Light but quite a drinkable pale ale, bitter and citrusy and very dry. Pretty good.

Can from Brewcraft at home as part of a haul of Magic Rock beers. Hazy orange amber pour with dense white head. Aroma is sort of juicy mango but a bit light. Taste follows with a bit more pine and again a light taste and palate. A bit empty but not bad. Smooth palate for a lighter beer.

Draft. A hazy amber beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of hops, straw, and spices. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, straw, citrus fruits, and hops, leading to a bitter finish.
From tap at Fermentoren. Hazy orange colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, caramel, hops, fruit, spice and bitterness.

From tap. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is peachy and solid grapefruity. Smooth fruity, crisp hoppy. Bitter and slight citrusy. Dry and solid hoppy to grapefruity. Dry, bitter and slight herbal finish.
Fra fat på Piccadilly Tap 21 Sep 16. Gylden. Amber / mørk aprikosfarget. Uklar. Lavt skum som daler raskt. Aroma av bensin & mango. Smaken mango & appelsin. Toner ut lett syrlig.

33cl can from De Bierkoning. Somewhat hazy amber / orange with a medium white soapy head. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Very present bitterness with well balanced fruity sweetness. Pine, grapefruit, tangerine, malts and caramel. Very nice!

Can. Pours orange. Aroma is strong green, tropical hops in the beginning. Later rather mild citrus, slight lime and guava. Taste is mild, slightly watery. Green, tropical fruit, lime, citrus. An alright quaffer.
Muddy dark golden with a lasting white head. Fruity hop aroma with citrus and peach. Sweet malty and fruity flavour with a medium bitter finish.

Canned. Pours hazy golden with an average off-white head. Aroma of orange zest, tangerine, grapefruit and caramel notes. Sweet flavor that ends up being dry and bitter for a Session. Light to medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice SIPA. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

0.33 can.   A hazy, faded copper color and a small, white head of poor retention. Aroma of pale malts, citruses, flowers, and delicate malts. Taste of pale malts, grains, grapefruits, bit of caramel perhaps. A medium body, a slick texture, and an average carbonation. Finish is medium long and rather simple. Overall the whole beer is relatively uncomplicated but genuinely pleasant.

(can)
Aroma:grapefruit,hint of mango,resin.
Appearance:hazy orange color,small ugly head.
Taste:dry, flavour of grapefruit,sweet citrus,bread,juicy fruity finish.
Palate:low to medium body,medium carbonation.
Overall:Insenly drinkable grapefruit-bomb.

Aroma is caramel, herbal, tropical fruit, bread, citrusy, very nice. Darker golden or amber colour. Easygoing. Taste is bittery, light citrusy and caramel. Nice compromise between british ales and american ales. Good choice for long winter evenings.

Can
Aroma-friuts, grapefruit
Appearance-amber, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, lightly sour, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good
Hazy amber with small white head. Fresh hop bag, Green grass and dank tutti frutty. Light, hoppy, floral and dry finish. Great!

Keg at BD Clerks, cloudy brown with a thin head, aromas of tropical fruit and something faintly earthy and vegetal. Initially slightly sweet and fruity with a milky texture, hints of pineapple, marmalade and sherbet, then a drier note cuts in along with an almost too acrid citrus bitterness.

Lovely citrus aroma in a hazy golden amber pour. Spot on hop forward balance for style with a citrus fruity body and sustained bitter finish. One of the tastiest session beers Ive had all year - and definitely worth having another (or more).

Can @ ÖÖWF2016: Aroma is apricot/mango fruit jam, light bread and grapefruit peelings. Taste is refreshing, juicy citrus notes like sweet orange and tangerines with ripe red grapefruit bite. Light pale malt base.

Aromas terrosos y florales
Bien aspecto transparente mala retención de espuma
En boca suave y ligeramente amarga y seca al final

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cask at The Euston Tap, London. A hazy golden/orange coloured pour with a medium white head on top. Hoppy, citrus, tropical fruit aroma. Tastes similar, hoppy, tropical fruit, grapefruit, juicy with a bitter finish. Nice easy drinking SIPA.

pours into a clear golden body with a crisp white head. aroma is hoppy with a fresh citrus, like folding the skin of an orange back on it self.the flavour is a somewhat watered down equivalent of the aroma.

Lata de @Zombier, Online 18/11/2016
Color amarillo, aromas frutales, sabor frutal, final amargo.

Pours a cloudy orange yellow with light carbonation and some lacing.

Aroma is lovely, a beautiful hoppy, malty blend with marmelade, grapefruit, ripe mango, caramel, pineapple and touch of banana. Taste is quite sweet with a good length finish and reasonable body for its strength.

Sensational session IPA, so much flavour for the ABV.

Fresh can. Very cloudy orange amber. Looks like all aboard the NE haze train. Aroma has loads of mango, some tropical fruit, some pine. Mouthfeel is somewhat creamy, dry. Finish is very bitter for the body. Very good and crushable, but bitterness is a bit too high. Splendid nonetheless
Świeże, dobrze zbalansowane, z delikatną podbudową słodową, wyraźnie owocowe, sosnowe. Goryczka solidna, przyjemna, sosnowa. Aromat lepszy niż smak, w zasadzie.
Mighty fine IPA that belies its session sensibilities. Wondering if this beer has a healthy dose of sauvin hops to make it as punchy as it is.
Fruity nose, high carbonation, bitter finish. Current core-beer batch not a patch on when it was a limited run - that said still very easy drinking

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, orange, tropical fruit, hops, citrus and grapefruit.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque golden/amber beer with a slight/medium off-white/beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, orange and tropical fruit; ends slightly bitter and dry with hops, citrus and grapefruit.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. A lot of juicy fruit flavours, feeling way stronger in terms of taste than its abv. Every other aspect is great as well. Super refreshing and thirst quenching.
Pour hazy amber with small white head. Good lacing. Citrus and floral notes on the nose. Fruity and juicy hops on the palate. Very refreshing and drinkable. Soft carbonation with lovely mouth feel,
Tap at Shelton Brothers. Grapefruit and mango nose with some crackery malt character. Fruity and dry, well-balanced for a low abv. Bitter-ish finish.

330 ml can. Pours hazy orange with an off white head. Nose is a big grapefruit, resinous hop punch with some sweet malt. Taste is sweet caramel malt, followed quickly by that juicy grapefruit and tropical fruit flavour. It is Juicy not just by name. Very good session beer at 4.5 % abv has the feel and taste of a Pale ale at 5-6 %. Awesome. So damn drinkable. Wish I had more than just the one can !!

Can at De Rat, Utrecht. Cloudy orange with an off white head. Aroma of resinous hops, grapefruit, pine, grassy notes and tropical fruits. Flavour is light sweet and moderate bitter. Light to light medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Can from mchughs. Citrus, pine, peel, mango nose. Flavour is a crisp biscuit with a lemon grapefruit bitter finish.

330 ml can bought in London, bb 28/02/17.
Dark amber to copper, hazy body, with a medium, fluffy, lacing, yellow head.
Aroma of passion fruit, mango, pineapple, kiwi, some grass, subtle pine.
Taste is a bit lighter, but crisp, with pine, citrus, orange, passion fruit, earth, some biscuit.
Light, a bit creamy mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes dry, medium bitter, a bit yeasty, with lots of lingering pine, citrus, flowers, slight biscuit.

Tasty. Lovely, tropical fruit nose, taste is also nice, with more crisp, piney notes, maybe a bit too light, but then very good for the ABV. Finishes great again, very crisp and piney. Overall an almost perfect style example, that drinks very easy, while being very hoppy and always keeping track of the balance.

At Maakuns. Shared from can. Metallic and hoppy nose. Sweet caramel malts, strong marijuana and vegetal hops, resin, oranges, grapefruit, lime, yeast, tea, biscuits, light oniony. Medium sweet and bitter. Mesium body, soft resiny and slightly chalky feel, mineral water, soft carbonation. Vegetal bitter finish. Very nice and crisp.

Can shared thanks to sjogro. Hazy dark orange golden with fluffy light beige head. Lots of grapefruit, lemon, marijuana, soft caramel, light orange. Light sweet and bitter. Under medium bodied. Very juicy alright! Love it.

Draft pour at the Shelton Brothers Festival. Pours a cloudy dark gold with a medium white head that forms a lasting film and ring. Pale and kind of toasty malt backbone, with florals, dry grains, grass, straw, and tea. The tropical fruitiness is very subtle here. Light-bodied, with medium carbonation and a malty, bitter mouthfeel. Good and satisfying and subtle.

Can, courtesy of JayCloudy dull golden color, generous head. The aroma is like fruit candy, amazing; also lots of perfume, soap. Its a bit too yeasty, some filtration would help, the malt is present, more than in other sIPAs, the hop is very resiny, there is a soapy note.Interesting, but unrefined.

Can from Biernavigatie, BB 28/02/17, large sample. Cloudy orange color, medium frothy head. Aroma of tropical fruit, peach, pineapple, citrus, cookie, caramel. Medium to high bitterness, quite dry, juicy, citrus, tropical fruit. Bit thin in the finish, but very thirstquenching. Good hop burp. Great.
Can from real Ale store Newark. Pale Amber colour with an off white head. Aroma is fruity mango and citrus. Taste nice sweet to mid bitter.
Can at home, 27th October 16. Pours light straw. Aroma is hay, fresh hops, citrus. Taste is clean, hops, good citrus, bitter, with a nice malty backbone. Nice for what it is.

33cl can from ales by mail. Appearance is cloudy dark gold to orange. Head is thin persistent and white. Body is medium. Medium high carbonation. Medium bitterness, light sweetness. Aroma is orange, hops, pine, pineapple, herby.

Can from Drygate shop a hazy golden beer with tropical fruit aroma mango pineapple flavour is grapefruit pineapple some tangerine peel giving some pithy bitterness juicy pale ale with pine and resinous flavour

Bottle in the Sitting Room, Saltburn. Hazy amber with a frothy cream head. Nice bog juicy mango, grapefruit and pineapple aroma. The taste has lots of grapefruit juice and mango. Bitter finish with some pine. A little bt thin bodied, but very tasty.
UPDATED: DEC 25, 2016 Can from keelham farm shop in Skipton. Poured pale amber. Promised a juicy IPA I found it more hoppy and earthy than juicy. Not bad though.

10/20 pale ale but has a sourness and bitterness to the taste. Also slightly watery (only 4.5%) 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can at home. Pours hazy golden amber with a nice lacy white head. Aroma is massive tropical fruits, somewhat dank, fresh and hoppy. Flavour is light to moderate bitter and light hoppy sweetness. Very clean and hoppy. Lots of flavour for a 4,5%! Very refreshing. Light to moderate body with moderate carbonation. Great.

Can. Nose is rich tropical , ripe pineapple, orange juice, tangerine,hint of lime. Fruity and appealing. Taste is surprisingly malty, leading to orange, honey, lime, pineapple, mango, then a pleasing bitter pine, resin, grapefruit and dank finish.

The current trend for beers which are fruit bombs are usually too sweet for me. This maintains a crisp bitter edge which I really like.
Pours unclear amber, small white head. Smell is bit bitter Taste is bitter. Bit malty. Not very aromatic. Not bad.

Can, The Offie, Leicester. Hazy golden orange with an off white foam. Oranges with light tropical fruit. Funky grass. Oily body. Pithy grapefruit bitterness. Bready malts. Mango comes through when warmed up. Woody, green pine. Lime running through the middle. Good session ipa.

Can. Slightly hazy orangeish amber colour with a mediumsized creamy head. Aroma is mango, tropical fruit juice, some floral and mild sweet malty notes. Flavour is quite similar, with some zesty notes to it as well. Mild bitterness, yet rather hoppy. Refreshing and very tasty.

Can (from beer navigator), BB 28.02.17. Pours hazy amber with whiteish head. Aroma is intense fruits, citrus, peach, pineapple, some diesel and garlic. Flavor is sweet and bitter, fruits, citrus, pineapple, peach, malt. Finish is sweet and grapefruit-dry bitter. Rather nice body for the ABV, feels light, but not thin (possibly because of the sweetness). Overall: very nice hoppy punch.
Sample at SBWF 2016. Hoppy and fruity smell with citrus. Similar taste. Refreshing. A bit spritsy.

330ml can @ Chez Sophie. Pours a hazed golden amber, white head. Aroma is tropical fruit, grapefruit. Taste is quite light with initial bitter exotic fruit fading out swiftly to make way for a bitter malty body. Nice session pale.

Can thanks to LKS. Pours deep golden orange, off white head. Aroma is peaches, juicy fruit, tangerine, bread. Flavor is peach, nectarine, dough, pine. Smells tastes and feels bigger than it is, solid flavor full session.

Keg @ BrewDog, Soho. Slightly hazy amber pour with a creamy white head. Fruity and floral nose. Flower water. Some orange peel. Mild cheese. Lemon curd. Just a bit of biscuit and a kiss of caramel. Flavor is fairly bitter - mostly floral/leafy. A bit of honeyed bread and caramel in support. light body, medium carb. Decent low boost hoppy gear, but not my favorite release from this generally fantastic producer.

Keg at Piccadilly Tap, shared with Finn. A filmy layer leaving rings of lace down the glass. Misty amber in body colour. Floral aroma with some impact of mango. Fresh fruity taste of mango, pineapple and grapefruit, juicy malts beneath. Fine bitter ending. Refreshing and with solid session qualities (Manchester 21.09.2016).

Can from We Brought Beer Balham, London - UK. Color: hazy amber beer with no carbonation and really small white foam. Smell: lime, citrus and hoppy domination. Juicy nose. Taste: light body small caramel malt presence balanced with high hoppy balst, high bitterness. Juicy with lime, citrus and pineapple notes. High attenaution. Aftertaste: wet bitterness, high lime and citrus taste; Watery sensation. Lack of balance...
Can from Bradleys. Hazy amber pour. Aroma is full of grapefruit, really fresh. Very juicy, hoppy beer. I would never have believed it was only 4.5%. Best session beer Ive ever tried.

33 cl can. BBE 23.02.2017.
Pours hazy orange color with a large white head. Nice tropical fruity aroma, mango and mandarin, some pineapple, piney, resin and crisp citric hops. Flavor has mandarin, mango, grapefruits, some citrus, resinous hops, mild malt notes and some grassy bitterness on the lingering aftertaste. Very refreshing with crisp hops and citric fruits. Excellent light IPA.
3515

10 cl. draft @ Billies Bier Kafeteria. Hazy orange with a big white head. The nose is clear fruity USA hop, exotic fruit & peach with a dough and fluffy white bread base. The taste is quite bitter up front, faint grain bitterness, oddly bitterness is all upfront & nothing in the finish, whole leads into a doughy white bread qualities, low lingering bitterness, but pretty much all from the start, some doughy yeast, lower fruity qualities than in the nose, still apricot, USA hop grass,... Body is lightly milky yeast, dough, faint soap. Could have popped more, but very solid & easy drinking beer overall. Despite the massive love that Session IPA style is getting, a 4.5 % ABV UK Session IPA beer - that is bit of a joke aint it?

The aroma just absolutely leapt out of the can - dominated by citrus with some floral hop and really strong. Not quite as powerful taste wise but pleasantly hopped with a refreshing citrus streak. Quite a cloudy orange pour. Nice beer.
Lovely Smell of peaches on the nose, appearance wise, very cloudy, but for its strength it really is an upfront fruity taste.
Pours hazy light amber with a medium foamy white head. Aromas of grapefruit, citrus, mango, resin, pine. Taste is very fruity and quite bitter. Mouthfeel is light bodied with medium carbonation.

Draught @ Gastropuben KICK Malt & Mat, Kristiansand
Pours hazy deep golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, biscuit, floral and grass. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter with a long caramel, biscuit, floral and grass bitter finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Can from Coppers, Newcastle. Orange amber in colour, pouring with a thin white head. It has a very rich orange marmalade flavour, malty notes with bitter pine and tropical notes on the fniish. Superb  the flavour of a Double IPA with the ABV of a session ale!

33cl can. Hazy golden colour with medium white head. Orange, grapefruit, passion fruit, pineapple and caramel in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium to low body. Taste is medium bitter with fruity notes. Dry and bitter finish. Overall, a very good beer.

Bottle 33cl
@ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
A: Hazy golden.
T: Hops, fruity, citrusy.

Holiday, top-50 fun hunt. #-3,Can, hazy oange with a white head. Aroma of fruits, malt, straw, hay, tropical, taste of medium sweetness, pretty bitter, citrus/lemon, grain, tropical fruits, smgo, medium body, peach, soft carbo, ok
Pours a hazy orange with a big frothy head. Aroma is lots of citrus. Juicy as described on the can. Taste is orange, grapefruit, some pine and some hops. Very nice.

22nd June 2016Can. Hazy gold beer, tidy white head. Palate is softish but still has good fine carbonation. Light malts, mild sweetness. Nice hops, good amount of orange, citric peel and grapefruit. Mild pine and hop spice. Light finish leaves a mild bitter linger.
Keg at Fynefest. Pours a deep gold with a small lasting white head. Aroma is grapefruit, straw, slight cantaloupe. Taste is toasty, malty, grapefruit, slight grass, dry finish.
Patricks 090616. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, hop, pine, peaches. Flavour is fruit, malt, hop, grapefruit, pine, oranges. Easy drinkable nice beer.

Pours orange with a large and frothy white head which lingers for a while. Aroma is earthy, pine, tropical fruits and some modest whiffs of hop resin. Taste is grassy, highly bitter, modest fruity sweetness but this is overshadowed by the IBUs.
Pours golden with a foamy head. Aroma is juicy citrus. A really nice, juicy beer with a little hint of bitterness. Could drink quite a few of these.

Can. Cloudy amber pour, with a quickly vanishing head. Nose is very promising: herbal / resinous hops. Palate is similarly hoppy, and mighty bitter too, but the carbonation seems a bit tight to me, and the finish is sticky rather than refreshing. 

 Decent beer all the same
Draft @ Taproom, Malmö. Pours a hazy orange color with a small white head. Has a fruity peachy hoppy citrus aroma. Fruity malty peachy hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy finish.

Bottle shared at the level 42, 24/05/2016. Many thanks to Matteo for this one. A hazed dark orange coloured pour with a a thin white head. Aroma is spicy pollen citrus, honey. Flavour is composed of crisp tangerine, pollen, light grains, lemon rind, light grains, tangy. Palate is light and crisp, highish carbonation, mineral. Good.

330ml can. Cloudy amber colour with average to huge, thick, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, white head. Tropical fruity, resinous, hoppy aroma, notes of passion fruit, grapefruit, lemon tea. Taste is moderately bitter hoppy, citrusy and tropical fruity, minimally sweet pale malty basis, notes of lemon, lemon tea, grapefruit, a touch of orange; minimally chalky, mineral bitterness in the finish.

Absolutely loved this. Very fragrant and hop forward yet balanced in sweetness and bitterness. Probably my favorite UK hoppy beer, the brits are getting better and better at brewing the US take on the style, this beer now leads the pack IMO.

Pours slightly hazy amber with decent white head. Aroma is very fruity hops with a touch of grass and lemon. Medium carbonation and light mouth feel. Taste is Orchard Fruit and grapefruit, almost gooseberry. Medium bitterness and dry. Very nice session beer

33cl can shared at Leightons had tasting on Level 42, London. Sourced via Beer Gonzo. it pours a clean rich golden color with a small white head. Aroma is rich in fruity tangy and weedy notes, plenty of grass, lemon peel, tangerine, weed and pine cones. Taste is also lightly sweet with stone fruit and persimmon, then medium tangy weedy with more weed and tangerine grass notes. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, delicious

Can thanks to Matteo. It pours hazy golden - amber with a medium wh The head. The aroma is fresh, juicy, nectarine, peach, candied peel, sherbet and more juicy action. The taste is smooth, bitter, nectarine, peach skin, fruit cobbler, pine and some peppery spice with a dry finish. Light body and average carbonation. Aroma stands out. Solid.

Dark amber color with a white head, short to medium duration. Aroma has notes of tropical fruits, lychee, orange and resins. Flavor has a good bitterness, pine notes with lot odf fruitnesss dominating lychees, grapefruit, bitter orange and light peach. Good bitterness in the final with with long duration. Very enjoyable.

Can from The Bottle Shop Canterbury. Hazy amber colour lasting beige head. Grapefruit aroma no doubt pink grapefruit. Too fizzy in the mouth. Flavour is excellent though. Its like drinking pink grapefruit juice. Harsh bitter hop and carbonic acid on the finish. But hell you will forgive the faults for the aroma flavour and sheer drinkability of this beer. Fruit juice in a can. Excellent.
Can from Ales By Mail. Hazy dark orange, reasonable head. Grain aroma. Candy hop flavour. Bitter sweet aftertaste. A classic smooth full flavoured session IPA

Can at home, 19/05/16.
Hazed golden orange with a well appointed egg shell white head of bubbles that retains well.
Nose is jammy citric fruits, apricot, mango, pine needle, red grapefruit, tangerine, juicy hops.
Taste comprises orange pith, citric tinged straw, pine, leafy hops, light dank strokes, grapefuit, toasted bread.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close pricked with pine needles and doused with leafy come skunky hop bitterness.
Solid bitter sessioner.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: FEB 27, 2017 Amazing smell tropical fruits. Mildly bitter and not very malty. Clean refreshing awesomeness

Can from Hops & Crafts Exeter, pours hazy orange with a white loose head,aroma is juicy grapefruit & tangerine ,the taste is similar bitter juicy grapefruit ,tangerine with some caramel in support, & some biscuity maltiness  ,slightly salty, light to medium bodied & smooth, the finish has more bitter grapefruit,tangerine ,salted caramel & tropical fruit flavours ,this is a really good session IPA !

Citrus fruits, grapefruit, light tropical fruits, passion fruit, pale grain malts. Hazy, dark amber, medium, frothy, off-white head. Medium bitter. Citrus fruits again, lemon, floral hops, grass, sweet orange in the finish, dry and bitter, lively carbonation. Stunning Session IPA, intense and complex flavours throughout. Can from We brought Beer, Clapham Junction.

Can from The Beerhive. Hazy amber body with a faint off-white head. Steady carbonation. Aroma of mango, caramel and orange. Flavour of pine, passionfruit and blood orange with a tinny finish. Medium body with a smooth, cask-like mouthfeel. Soft fizz. Fruity and flavoursome.

Can from Favourite Beers in Cheltenham purchased and consumed Saturday 14th May 2016 at the Caravan Club campsite Cheltenham Racecourse. Gold in colour with a white head   Pours warm gold with just a light haze, and a white head atop. Malty on the nose, though this is shot through with some pine, tangerines and a little grapefruit. Predominantly citrussy in the mouth, light and easy drinking but good flavoursome beer for the strength. Sweet grapefruit and sweet orange mainly, but it is really juicy with a dry and bitter finish. A7 A4 T8 P4 Ov15 3.8

Can at home. Pours hazy copper orange. Nose is juicy hoppy and fruity, passionfruit, resin, grapefruit, light tart. Taste is juicy, bitter fruity, grapefruit, passionfruit, lime. Good balance, sessionable indeed.

330ml can from the Clove Hitch, Liverpool. Orange golden colour with a white foam head leaving alittle lacing and aroma of juicy mango and hop resins. Taste is malt caramel with fruity mango, orange citrus, hoppy, resiny, pine and grapefruit bitterness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry hoppy & tangy bitter finish. Very drinkable.

30/IV/16 - on tap @ Tilquin English Beer Festival - BB: n/a (2016-456) Thanks to the Belgian Ratebeer Crew (and Beerhunter111) for sharing todays beers!
Clear orange beer, creamy aery off-white head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: grains, bit malty, fruity, grapefruit, pineapple. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: very fruity start, lots of citrus, bitter, little funky, grains, some cow fodder. Aftertaste: hoppy, grapefruit, bitter, bit metallic, still very fruity, lots of pineapple and citrus.

330ml can at home as Magic Rock Inhaler Juicy Pale Ale, 4.5%, BB Oct 2016. Dark amber, translucent, pretty still with a big dense foamy tan head. Aroma is pine, mint leaves, celery, touch of mango. Body is a little frothy with soft carbonation. Taste is pine, some dank oniony notes, a little floral tincture, gooseberry, herbal astringency, crisp and dry into the finish. Very hoppy for the ABV yet also has a nice balance. Maybe just leans a touch too much towards Stop N Grow, but is still very tasty.

Can at home in London - picked up at Kris Wines. Pours mostly clear, bright gold with a creamy, white head. Great aroma, full of pithy tangerine and grapefruit, underscored with a bit of pale bread. Light-medium sweet flavour with some grassy bitterness, and juicy citrus fruits, pith, more tangerine, orange, grapefruit, biscuits. Light bodied with average carbonation. At once dry and resinous to close, with assertive piney and grassy bitterness, some rindy an pithy citrus, all supported by a sound pale malt base. Outstanding. This is the kind of thing a guy could drink all day.
Overall: Toffee, tropical fruits, grass.Note: On-tap at De Klomp. Reviewed 2016-05-09.
Pours hazy copper with low off-white head. Aroma of lemon, peach, light resin. Taste is mild sweet with a lingering medium bitter finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.

On keg at the Maltings, York. Served pale and cloudy, with a good condition. Has a strong pleasant citrus taste with strong grapefruit, mango and lemongrass notes. Has a strong spicy bitter finish. Excellent.

Hazy bright light golden, decent bubbly white cap and faint lacing. Nose is grassy, peppery papaya and minerally sweetness. Initial taste is a decent quench of papaya, real earthy pineapple and a nice belonging bitterness. Carbonation is firm and mouthfeel quick and painless. Finishes very clean, steely passionfruit seediness and lingers a nice gummy lime. Very pleasant work here. Less gripping than a High Wire but very pleasant for it. Van, Little Leeds Beer House
From Tap. Leicht trübes orange goldenes Bier mit geringen weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hopfig bitter, Citrusfrüchte. Geschmack sehr hopfig, grasig bitter, wenig Aprikosen.

Draft @ Tilquin English Fest 16, courtesy of and shared with the fine Belgian RB crew. 
Couleur fin orangé, col épais crémeux beige.
Bouquet au nez houblonné très prenant surtout au niveau session IPA, cest complexe plein dagrumes, hop bag, rétro fin malté.
Palais est plutôt bien ancré sur les malts, pâle et pils, mais plutôt sur un grains bien tourné et complété par un profil houblonné superbement frais de pin, agrumes.

Great session IPA. Punches way above its weight, plenty of juicy tropical fruits... mango & passionfruit... bit of pepper, solid malt backbone... moderate bitter, and only ever so slightly watery. Lovely.
Draft at Tilquin English Beerfestival. Juicy it is! Bitter, hops, exotic fruits, some passion fruit, great!!

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Malmö, Malmö (02/04/2016) - medium hazy amber coloured pour with white head. Aroma and taste is a mix of tropical and citrus fruits, medium pale malts, some light caramel, tangerine, grapefruit, peachy, lemon, refreshing fresh and juicy, hoppy bitter finish. Solid.

Keg at The Hop Inn, Newcastle-Under-Lyme. A cloudy amber colour with a frothy white head. Aroma of orange sherbet, passion fruit, some peach, slight biscuit and subtle peppery hops. Taste of orange, passion fruit, peach, slight biscuit, a little resin and subtle peppery, grassy hops. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A dry, slightly peppery, citrus hop bitterness in the finish. A citrusy, fruity session IPA with a slight resinous and peppery hop bitterness late on. Well made from Magic Rock. Isnt exciting but does the job overall.
4.5abv Keg at the hanging bat..... Soft zezty passion fruit nose... Over fizzy... Little cold... Big passion... Soft zez... Tiny peppery hop
Keg at Cotteridge Wines; hazy amber pour with a thin white head, aroma has citrus and light pine, taste has resinous pine, some biscuit, cirtrus.

Keg @ Victorian Craft Beer Café, Halifax. Amber with a thin head. Hoppy with a slightly sour citrus fruitiness, but fairly stated with its tropical fruit. Theres a good blast of pineapple, and its aftertaste is long, dry and flavourless.

Growler fill. Turners, Sheffield. Cloudy, dark orange. Bubbly, off white head. Nose has nicely juicy, fruit salad hoppage. Orange pulp. Orange zest. Sweet, biscuity malts. Notes of peach and vanilla. Taste is pithy, zesty bitter. Some crisp dryness. Zingy, lively mouthfeel. Fresh, crisp, punchy bitter finish. Fantastic sessioner. Drinks way above its ABV.
Keg at the Hanging Bat. Pours hazy golden with a thin white head. Aromas of tropical fruit, resinous hops, citrus. Taste is bitter, light sweet fruits. Dry finish.
